Fields.DialogueText: Hey, Kanchou. Do you have a minute to talk about something really important?

Fields.MenuText: I always have time for you.
Depends on what you think is important.
Aoba, I've been dealing with "important" things all day. Personally, I'd rather do something fun.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, thanks! That's kind of you to say.
I think a vacation is probably the most important thing we could talk about right now.
Perfect! Let's go on vacation!
What are you talking about?
We've been working really hard lately. I mean, we've been fighting powerful Morganas after powerful Morganas. I think we've all earned a break.
And, what? You think the Morganas out there will just give us the week off?
I'm not saying we should stop fighting the Morganas. I'm just saying we should fight them somewhere else. Somewhere... more pleasant.
I see. And would this pleasant place be, oh, let's see... Japan? I do regularly hear you refer to it as the "best country on the planet."
Actually... I've never been to Hollywood before...
Now that's a surprise.
*ALARM*
And so is that.
Well, don't stand there in a stupor. This is a surprise that could destroy the ship.
@BATTLE
Aoba, what are you doing down here?
Kanchou? What are you doing down here? I never see you in the engine room.

Fields.MenuText: Some officers let me know you were up to something with the engine. I figured I'd check it out for myself.
Maybe I just wanted to hang out with you. I'm not getting in your way, am I?
Uhhhh... I asked first!

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, those nosy good-for-nothings. It's not like I'm breaking anything.
Well, no, not really. I suppose you're far from the worst company a girl could have.
Hmmmm... that's true enough... but that reaction is a little juvenile, Kanchou.
If you must know, I'm eking out as much power from this old girl as I can. The faster we go, the faster we get to Hollywood.
You know going to Hollywood is a long shot, don't you? The chances of Command having some sort of assignment there for us are...
Hai, hai! I know! Still, a girl can be hopeful.
*ALARM*
Can a girl be helpful too?
Aren't we always?
@BATTLE
I keep wanting to use that exotic Funayūrei fuel we collected from that last battle. I won't, because I think it would kill me, but you wouldn't believe the kick that stuff has.
Kanchou, Kanchou! isn't it beautiful?
Whoa! Aoba... what have you done to the ship?
You mean, what I have I done to myself? It's not finished, but I smacked on a fresh coat of paint. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: I think it looks amazing. And that you'll certainly catch the Morganas off guard.
Personally, I think you'd look best in purple, but what you have going on here is a good look as well.
I really think you should be focusing on function over form. Looking good isn't going to defeat the Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: Seriously? That's what I was going for. This new look makes me feel unstoppable.
Purple, huh? Nah, I like my look. The brighter the better, I say.
So you admit that I'm looking good. That's what I wanted to hear.
What I want to know is if you're battle ready.
I'm always battle ready... although some of the paint might still be a bit wet.
*ALARM*
Then I suggest you put up a few "wet paint" signs and hope for the best in the upcoming battle.
Ha! Who knows, perhaps I'll think of an even better paint scheme during the battle.
That wouldn't surprise me in the least.
@BATTLE
What are those, Aoba? Some blueprints?
Seikai da! You got in one, Kanchou - I was playing with some ideas.

Fields.MenuText: Any dangerous ideas?
Ideas that would give Japan the upper hand in the war?
Speaking of ideas you've had...

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose that would depend on how they were used... an egg could be dangerous in the right hands
Any of my ideas could, potentially, do that. But that doesn't mean I'll ever succeed in getting them to work.
Oh, come on, Kanchou, just spit it out. What's on your mind?
You know what I want to know, Aoba. Are you still working on that weapon?
Presently? No. I know you're not fond of the idea.
Then what are you doing with all of those Morgana parts laying in the corner?
A girl can think about the future.
*ALARM*
Well, it looks like you might have the opportunity to add to your pile.
Oh, please - you know I'd only save the most premium parts for something like that weapon.
@BATTLE
I think you mean "in the wrong hands".
Eh, it could go either way.
Morangas spotted off the starboard bow!
@BATTLE
What's this? Have we made port?
We were running low on supplies. We may not have been in imminent danger of starvation, but the hygiene issues were getting... let's just say "ripe" and leave it at that.
I had no idea! How long was I working in my room? Everything looks different.
You know, if you spent less time below deck tinkering and more time up here with the crew, you'd be less confused.
Where are we? Nothing looks familiar.

Fields.MenuText: Guess.
We're in California. Like you wanted.
Oh, come on, you should know. It was your idea, after all.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't like to guess. When I do, I usually end up disappointed.
California? Wait, we're in Hollywood?!
My idea? Wait, are we in Hollywood?
Well, we're as close as we can get while on a heavy cruiser. That over there is the Port of Los Angeles.
YATTA!
Hey, quiet down. Remember, you want to remain calm and collected. If you act like you belong, you belong.
But I'm so excited! I don't know what I should do first. Oh, I...I have to go make a plan.
Sounds like this will be an interesting "vacation."
Just try.
I want us to be in Hollywood. So...are we?
This is hugely disappointing.
You're not happy with Hollywood?
No. I mean, yes... It's just that, we're so close and yet so far away. I can't even see the Hollywoodland sign.

Fields.MenuText: I mean... I can see why you would be disappointed.
Try saying that with a smile. It's all about inflection.
Trust me, Aoba. There's nothing special about Hollywood. The ship is a far better place to be.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought being near Hollywood would be enough to make me happy... turns out, I was wrong.
I can't even see the Hollywoodland sign... Nope. Still disappointed.
Then maybe you should be the Belle and I'll be in command for a day.
What did you want to see in Hollywood? Other than the Hollywoodland sign, of course.
Promise not to make fun of me?
I solemnly swear.
I wanted to meet Buster Crabbe.
The actor who plays Flash Gordon?
N-nani? Fuu-. No. I-I...you should... you should just hush.
I'll take that as a yes. Buster Crabbe is a solid choice. I've heard several female crew members refer to him as a "dreamy."
*mumblemumble*
Words. Use your words, Aoba.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Morganas are coming! Let's go!
Heh. Good grief.
@BATTLE
... Aoba, do you have a celebrity crush?
*ALARM*
Well, that Morgana looks familiar.
I do believe that's Calamity. You think she's holding some sort of grudge against us after defeating her last time?
Whatever her motives, she's here. Let's worry about the fight ahead of us for now.
Hai - you're right. Let's get to it.
@BATTLE
That was odd.
I know what you mean. It was Calamity, all right. But her fighting style was more like Delusion's.

Fields.MenuText: I don't care how she fought. We still defeated her.
Actually, I was talking about that smell. Do you smell that? Does it smell like apples to you too? Is it pie day?
Are Morganas capable of learning from one another?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know. Any change in Morgana tactics should be viewed as worrisome, I'd say.
What? I don't smell anything. Stop thinking with your stomach.
I hope not. That's not something I want to think about.
I hope they're not... no, they couldn't be... right?
Something you want to share, Aoba?
I have to check on something. I'll get back to you later, Kanchou.
I've given you some time. Anything you care to share about our last battle, Aoba?
Did you take notice of Calamity's armor, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: I...guess I was a little busy trying to sink her to take notice of what she was... eh, wearing.
The configuration had changed - I'd assumed she'd just harvested steel from some poor victim and added armor.
Just spell it out for me, Aoba.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose I can't exactly fault you for that.
I'm impressed by your observational skills, Kanchou.
It wouldn't hurt you to take a guess.
It wasn't just Calamity's fighting style. She had fashioned parts of her armor to resemble the stronger aspects of Delusion's armor.
So, you're worried that the Morganas are combining their strengths.
Hai. Were they to find success in this plan, we might soon find ourselves facing, well...an armada of super-Morganas.
I couldn't agree more.
*ALARM*
Let's hope these incoming Morganas are more of the old-fashioned variety.
And if they aren't, well... maybe we can learn more about whatever the Morganas might be planning.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: That sounds like the last thing we need.
I think it's more likely to be a half-baked effort to confuse us. Giving you Lexington's conning tower wouldn't give you special American powers.

Fields.DialogueText: ... I think I'd rather have special Japanese submarine powers from I-8.
Noted. But there have been experiments with Belle equipment swaps, and to the best of my knowledge results have been negligible.
Funayūrei are different from us, though.

Fields.MenuText: Let's not panic just yet.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou! I'm not panicking. I'm just trying to see the shape of what's coming.
Saying goodbye to California?
I wish we could have had more time here. I wish I could have gone further inland. But if the Funayūrei are planning what I think they're planning, we need to be ready.

Fields.MenuText: You have your priorities straight.
You know, if you ask me, it's best not to meet your heroes.
Still wish you could've met Buster Crabbe?

Fields.DialogueText: They're not just my priorities. I fight for Japan. And for the world. And I can't forget that.
You might have a point. What if I had met Buster Crabbe and he turned out to be an idiot? I don't know if I would have been able to watch Flash Gordon again.
Hai - but I could still have another chance. Hollywood isn't going anywhere.
What's that bottle? Are you drinking away your sorrows?
Not today, Kanchou. This is a message in a bottle. I'm debating whether or not to hold onto it.
Is it for Buster Crabbe?
... Maybe.
No use holding onto it. And who knows? Maybe he'll find it.
Hmmm... I guess you're right. All right, cross your fingers.
Wait, what are you do—
*CRASH*
Whoa, that bottle went further than I thought it would. I think I hit that window over there.
You're supposed to... you know, never mind. Okay, let's get out of here before people start asking questions.
@BATTLE
Hai.
You called for me, Kanchou?
I received a report from the INFP regarding Japan. Our fears have come to light.
The IJN heard about my inventions and are disappointed in me?
That's really your worst-? No, never mind. Not that.
An... incarnation of Calamity was spotted in that area, and it's the same situation we encountered before. Anomalous tactics, atypically powerful weaponry, markings from another Morgana.
Oh, is that all? We can handle Calamity.

Fields.MenuText: But we can't handle Japan's disappointment?
And how do we do that?
I'm glad you're confident. If anyone is going to clean this mess up, it'll be us.

Fields.DialogueText: ... That would mean that everything I've done up to this point was for naught. It's my worst nightmare.
I have a trick or two up my sleeves. You'll see.
You better believe it.
Has anyone engaged Calamity since she arrived in Japanese waters?
Not yet. Command believes that she's still making modifications to her ship.
Well then, it's probably best that we engage her as soon as possible. We can't let Japan down.
It's good to support your homeland, Aoba. But if their approval of you is of the utmost importance to you, well...
That could put a lot of pressure on you. You understand that, don't you?
It's not a problem for me.
Not now, maybe. But in the future...?
I appreciate you looking out for me, Kanchou. But honestly. I'm fine.
@BATTLE
Over at Command, there's increasing concern that you might be on to something with your fears of Morgana grafts leading to "super-Morganas."
So our job is to investigate and to forcefully discourage the project.
Hey, Kanchou, I need something sturdy, yet flammable. Know of anything I can use?

Fields.MenuText: ...Wood?
I shouldn't have to tell you I'd rather you not light fires aboard the ship, right?
What are you building this time?

Fields.DialogueText: I already tried wood. It was crushed like a twig. I'm in need of something sturdier.
Let me assure you, Kanchou, that I have everything under control.
I'm not really sure how to explain it. I'd have to show it to you.
If you're starting another crazy experiment, I'm here. You know, if you need an extra set of hands.
An experiment isn't crazy if you know what you're doing. And thanks, I'll keep your offer in mind if I need you.
But really, this is just a small project to occupy my mind while we travel. I'm worried about what's waiting for me back home.
You shouldn't be nervous. No matter what's waiting for you, we've tackled worse. Together, we can take whatever the Morganas throw at us.
... You really believe that, don't you?
I do.
*ALARM*
Sounds like it's time to prove it.
@BATTLE
Kanchou? We know we're going to be facing a considerable threat in Calamity once we find her, don't we?
More than likely. We have no way of knowing how strong she'll be once we reach Japan.
Exactly. So wouldn't it be a good idea if we had... I don't know... a secret weapon up our sleeves?

Fields.MenuText: You better not be talking about what I think you're talking about.
Well, of course. A secret weapon would be useful in almost any situation.
That depends on what you have in mind.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai - but this is the last time I'll bring it up, I swear.
Exactly. And we both know that, were I to perfect my design, that weapon would be the best weapon to use against Calamity.
Oh, you know what I have in mind. And you have to admit, it could end up being very useful.
...Okay. Start working on it.
But with this weapon, we could blow the Morganas out of the water.
Aoba, I said yes. Get to work.
Wait, what? Seriously?
I expect you to give me regular updates on how progress is coming, and should I decide to scrap the project at any point, for any reason, you would need to comply.
But we need to be prepared for Calamity. Having a trick or two up our sleeves wouldn't hurt.
This... this is perfect! I'll get right to work. Thank you, Kanchou!
Aoba! I expect the rest of the ship to be battle-ready as well. A secret weapon can only do so much. Make sure the crew and guns are ready to go.
Hai! Right, yes, of course, I'll work double time! This is going to be great, Kanchou. Just wait until you see what I can do!
Make us proud, Aoba.
I will. You can count on that!
I hope I don't live to regret this...
@BATTLE
Another coat of paint, Aoba? I would've thought you'd be working on that weapon of yours.
I can do both. And besides, you told me you wanted the ship battle ready.
True enough.
Actually, it's good that you're here - I need a second, impartial opinion.
I'm experimenting with different looks. I need one which will impress my countrymen, while also hopefully disorienting any Morganas we might encounter. What do you think?
Well, I'm not impartial, but I always have opinions.
Perfect. If you were Japanese, would my current appearance dazzle you or what?

Fields.MenuText: Or what.
Hmmm... I'm still hung up on the color. I think a little purple here and there would be an improvement.
Honestly, the longer I look at it, the more nauseated I feel.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm... really? Hm. I think you're right. There are better color combinations I could use.
We're going to Japan, sir. I will not budge from red and white and a touch of black. But the pattern could be improved upon, I think.
I was worried the scheme might have that effect on humans. I'll need to rethink the design.
Looks as if I still have quite a bit of work in front of me. I'm a little worried that I won't be battle ready by the time we arrive.
I have faith in you, Aoba. You'll be ready.
*ALARM*
Unfortunately, I'm not ready yet.
You still have time. And don't worry about these Morganas, they shouldn't pose much of a threat.
@BATTLE
Morgana patrol spotted!
@BATTLE
Aoba? You rushed off as soon as the battle was over. Is everything all right?
Gomen! I just had a rush of inspiration. Just a bolt of lightning in my mind. I understand now.
Does this have something to do with your paint scheme?
Hai! I know what I need to do, the perfect color and pattern combination. During the battle, it just hit me.

Fields.MenuText: Something hit you? No wonder you're acting so strange.
Yada yada yada, just tell me you'll be ready.
Go on.

Fields.DialogueText: No, I meant... You know what, never mind.
I'll be ready. I'll definitely be ready.
Oh, I'm sorry, I'm talking too much. I should stop the mouth and start the hands.
Now, please, I need to be obsessive now. I have a lot of work to do before we reach Japan.
Right. If you need me, you know where to find me.
Of course, Kanchou. Thank you for your help.
Well, I think they've seen us.
Hai. We're going to have to be careful in this upcoming battle—they could be capable of anything.
That's reassuring.
Don't worry, we've fought tougher.
Also... what do you think of my new paint scheme?

Fields.MenuText: It's simpler than it was before.
Honestly, I appreciate the restraint you've shown. The result is more striking.
It looks a little like every other ship's paint job.

Fields.DialogueText: I know! I realized my previous attempts were far too elaborate. Sometimes simple is most effective.
Stop it, Kanchou, you're going to make me blush. I just hope it's good enough to impress Japan.
It does not! Not if you look closely. But, I will admit, the scheme is much more subtle than my previous attempts.
*BOOM*
Looks like the battle's starting.
Oh, good. Let's break in this new paint scheme!
How about we leave the breaking to the Morganas?
@BATTLE
So, was I impressive, or was I super impressive?

Fields.MenuText: I'm just going to say "yes." I think your paint scheme had the intended effect on the Morganas.
You did well, but I think the crew would have performed better if they had been given a little more time to get used to the new paint.
Honestly? You were impressive, but I think purple would have made you even more impressive.

Fields.DialogueText: Aww, Kanchou! There's no better compliment I can receive than being told that my plan was a success.
That's fair. The crew would probably appreciate a little consistency in paint color in the coming days.
... If you say that one more time, I'm going to stop talking to you.
I'm afraid I didn't call you in to talk about the paint scheme, though. We received a new report.
What's the bad news?
Calamity attacked Fukuoka harbor.
How much damage did she do?
Extensive damage. She's altered her abilities so much that no ships nearby were prepared for the threat she posed.
Well then, we know what we need to do.
Agreed.
@BATTLE
I don't like that they're running.
You think they're leading us into a trap?
That, or they're leading us away from a more important target. Probably both.
Hai - I agree. Looks as if the Morganas really don't want us reaching Calamity.

Fields.MenuText: Fortunately, we have our secret weapon.
This is looking more perilous by the second.
We're not just fighting for ourselves, Aoba. We can't afford to lose now!

Fields.DialogueText: No, we don't! I told you, I'd let you know when I had something that would work! The trigger mechanism is-
Don't talk like that, Kanchou. We must reach Japan.
Hai! That's right, Kanchou! We're fighting for Japan!
Let's show these Morganas why they should never stand between me and my homeland!
@BATTLE
I was talking about you, Aoba!
Ha...ha. Right. Of course.
They're chanting your name out there, Aoba.
Heh, really?
Well, they were, but you were down below. What were you doing?
Tending to the engine. We've been going non-stop for a while now, and I'd rather avoid preventable problems if possible. You know, like fires.

Fields.MenuText: That's excellent initiative on your part. Thank you, Aoba.
Were we really at risk of a fire?
Now that would've been a show. You could've gotten yourself a new nickname or something.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Kanchou. Hopefully, I'll get to see my countrymen more in the future.
We're at risk of a whole host of issues if we don't take care of the ship, Kanchou. You should know that.
Hmmm... the Burning Belle doesn't sound too bad. But I'd prefer to get it in a less literal way.
You made Japan proud today.
That's kind of you to say, Kanchou.
And for what it's worth, you made me proud too.
It's worth more than you think.
Go take a breather. We'll be heading out to search for Calamity soon, and I'm going to need you well-rested when we depart.
Hai.
@BATTLE
The Sea of Japan is thick with Morganas. If they were more organized, this would be apocalyptic.
That's for certain. I'm glad I went with a more subtle paint scheme - my previous attempts would have made us a little too visible to all of the Morganas in the area.
Yeah, that wouldn't have been pleasant.
You know, perhaps they're all here to observe Calamity. To see how she performs in battle. To determine whether they'll make the same changes she's made.

Fields.MenuText: That's a good theory. You're a smart one, Aoba.
Well, then - it's imperative that we find her and defeat her as soon as possible.
I don't typically think of the Morganas being so methodical. Which makes them harder to predict in the long run.

Fields.DialogueText: Aww, another of my favorite compliments! Arigatō!
Easier said than done, I'm afraid.
*sigh*
Oh, before I forget, I wanted to give you my latest report. I'm making good progress on the weapon.
You think you'll have it operational by the time we find Calamity?
It can be difficult to find the time to work when I'm constantly interrupted by other Morganas, but I'm certainly hoping so.
Well, what are you doing talking to me? Go get to work.
Here I was, thinking you liked talking to me.
I do, but I also like breathing.
@BATTLE
As it is, we're just picking off cluster after cluster, and they keep on coming.
Isn't that a little small to be a secret weapon, Aoba?
What? Oh, this? No, this is just the weapon's ammunition. Or, really, the shell in which the explosive will go. And I have to make several - prototype after prototype until I reach perfection.

Fields.MenuText: Shouldn't it look a little more... intimidating? It looks like an American football.
Perfection, you say? That's a tall order. You must love keeping busy.
Hey, if you make them all that color, I'm on board with whatever plan you have in mind.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I can assure you it's not a football. Footballs don't blow Morganas into a million pieces.
You'd be surprised how little time these actually take to build. It's just a little more... expensive than I'd prefer.
I figured that you'd earned something purple, by this point.
Did you need something, Kanchou?
Calamity was just sighted by another INPF ship. We've been given her coordinates and are headed her direction now.
You could have led with that! How was she found so quickly?
The INPF has had all ships in the area on the lookout. The crew which found her barely escaped with their lives.
They engaged her? We'd better hurry then if we want her to still be in the area when we arrive.
We'll reach her soon. Assuming, of course, that we don't run into any Morganas on the way.
When do we ever not run into Morganas on the way?
Fair point.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
We're in the thick of it now. The Morganas are closing in on us.
Wait a minute... is that - there! That's Calamity! I think... she looks like a beast.

Fields.MenuText: That's not her. I mean, I don't think that's her. It looks nothing like the ship we saw off the coast of California.
I guess I can kind of see the resemblance...if I squint my eyes and tilt my head.
Dammit, can we shut off that alarm? Obviously there are Morganas nearby!

Fields.DialogueText: She looks different, but she has the same energy. I'm sure of it.
That's her... she smells the same.
Don't let the pressure get to you, Kanchou. We all need to be ready.
*BOOM*
They've closed off our exit.
Were we planning on running away?
We were not. And this means Calamity can't run off, either.
Where's that secret weapon, Aoba?
I... give me one second. I'll be right back.
Where are you going? We're in the middle of something up here!
I'll be right back! Hold 'em off for me!
@BATTLE
Aoba, where have you been? We need you in position!
Move back, Kanchou. I'm only going to get one shot with this thing.
That's your secret weapon? It's... a lot smaller than I thought it would be.
It's a prototype, but I'm confident it will do the trick.

Fields.MenuText: Give 'em hell, Aoba.
You know, I can't wait to see this.
Just be careful. I don't want you getting hurt.

Fields.DialogueText: I do believe that's my job.
You might want to shield your eyes. It's going to get bright in here.
You don't have to worry about me. I'm here to protect you.
*CRASH*
*BOOM*
Woah!
That's a direct hit on Calamity! That ought to give us more of an advantage in the upcoming battle.
Aoba, are you're smoking?!
You bet I am! With a shot like that, I'm smoking hot!
No! The launcher is smoking!
Oh, right... it, um, does that...
Don't worry about it. We need to focus on Calamity. She's not down yet!
Good grief...
@BATTLE
Calamity's defeated... you think that sent the message we were hoping to send to the rest of the Morganas?

Fields.MenuText: Judging by the way the stragglers are running away, I'd say yes.
I hope. We have enough trouble with non-modified Morganas.
I'd say it's only a matter of time before other Morganas try what Calamity tried. But hopefully, this might delay their efforts.

Fields.DialogueText: Look at them go! That's what I like to see.
You can say that again.
Better than nothing, I suppose.
I have to admit, Aoba, I wasn't sure what to expect from that weapon of yours, but your work really saved the day.
It did, didn't it? Heh, yeah... its effectiveness even surprised me. Though I have to admit, I still haven't yet perfected the launcher prototype.
Perfect is relative. In my opinion, the... weapon is perfect enough.
Oh! I haven't named it yet, have I? How could I have forgotten such an important step!
Well, you were keeping it a secret from everyone for quite a while.
What am I going to name you, weapon? You're my crowning achievement. I suppose I could name you something clichéd, or maybe something with my name in it? Hmmm...
You're not paying attention to me anymore, are you?
Huh? Did you say something, Kanchou?
I would get that prototype down to your workshop before it catches fire.
...Ack! Right! Oh, right. Good idea.
She's hopeless. Brilliant, but hopeless.
@BATTLE
A lot of the credit has to go to Calamity and the other Funayūrei, believe it or not.
... Okay. I'm intrigued.
You remember the camouflage goo? The coating on the Morgana vessels that allowed them to blend in with the ocean at distance?
The stuff you were putting on your battlesuit. Sure.
Hai. I'm not doing that anymore. It turns out that it's extremely volatile when mixed with those samples of Funayūrei superfuel we gathered a while back.
The trick with the bomb was keeping them in separate cylinders inside my little purple eggshell, and then having them mix and explode upon impact.
The thing was, that... form of Calamity was just a mess. I mean, she was hemorrhaging cloaking fluid - the system must've been broken during her upgrades.
So when the bomb hit that stuff...
Half her upgrades were blown off in a second. Hai!
Okay. Okay, that's very good. How many of these things can we produce?
The good news is that I think I've figured out an easy way to make the shells themselves, and the launcher itself is... um... a useful prototype.
And the bad news is... ah. We're out of the Morgana fuel.
And most of the camouflage goo. So we need to find a way to restock.
Or else they give up on using one or both. Either way, I'd say we win.
You're in a good mood.
That thing blew up very satisfyingly.
What's going on down here?
My armor took a few bad hits against Calamity. There's no fire to be seen, so I guess that's a plus.
I wanted to...
Kanchou, before you say anything, I need to get this out.
Sure... sounds urgent. What's going on?
If this is about me kicking the purple football before I realized it wasn't actually a purple football, let me just say that -
Don't make jokes right now, Kanchou. I'm trying to be serious.
When we first encountered Calamity, before we fought her off California, I was in the midst of scavenging Morgana parts to make my own weapons.
I think there's a... possibility she started modifying her own design as a result of seeing my own efforts at doing something similar.
I grant you, there was something... psychologically different here. But I can't believe that's down to you.
Still, if I'd just been content with weapons, there's the possibility that Calamity would have never gone down this road. That the harbor would have never been attacked.
So, learn from this experience. That's the only thing you can do. Learn, and do your best to avoid similar mistakes in the future. That's what much of life is, honestly.
Thanks, Kanchou. That's helpful. You're... you're really important to me, you know that?
You're really important to me too, Aoba. I'll always be here for you...you know that, don't you?
I do. And I'll always be here for you as well.
You know, Aoba...
*ALARM*
*sigh* Talk later?
Hai. Of course.
@BATTLE
Nope. Stop. Not only can you not know that, it's objectively unlikely. Salvaging ship parts and grafting them onto themselves has always been the pattern.
There you are, Kanchou. Should we continue that conversation of ours?
We most certainly should. But before we do, I have something special for you!
Something special? You shouldn't have!
Oh, I should've - but this time I didn't. I was talking about this letter from the Japanese government - but if you'd rather not give it a look...
Wait, what's going on? Are you serious? Is it for me?

Fields.MenuText: No, it's for Officer Murphy.
It's addressed to you. You can check, it's signed and everything.
Of course I'm being serious. This wouldn't be a very funny joke.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't get flippant with me, Kanchou!
Signed? By whom? I'm reading this right now.
You're right. It'd be cruel...this better not be filled with confetti.
So?
Ack! Look at this! It's Isoroku Yamamoto's signature! It's his actual signature! I have to frame this.
Are you sure it wasn't signed by his assistant? That can be pretty common.
Hush and get me a frame!
*ALARM*
... I hate them so much.
I know, and it's really cute. Oh, I think I have a frame in my room. Start without me, I'll be right there!
She sure is adorable when she's all excited like that.
... I think my biggest rival for her affection might actually be Japan.
This... could make things tricky.
@BATTLE
Before I do, can I just say -
Wait. I really like you too, but -
I'm sorry. You what?
Isn't that what you were going to say? Tell me I didn't read that wrong!
Ah... no. But -
Oh, thank goodness. Because you are incredibly attractive and I want to tell you about it in detail. ButI need to get this somewhere safe before -
